question: As per Indian State of Forest Report 2017, which of the following is the correct order of forest types in the country?
option1: Very dense forest> open forest> moderately dense forest
option2: Moderately dense forest> open forest> very dense forest
option3: Open forest> moderately dense forest> very dense forest
option4: Moderately dense forest> very dense forest> open forest
answer: Moderately dense forest> open forest> very dense forest
explanation: The ISFR 2017 shows that moderately dense forest (MDF) covers the highest area 308,318 sq. km (9.38% of GA) followed by open forest 301,797 sq. km (9.18% of GA) and very dense forest 98, 158 sq. km (2.98% of GA) respectively.
